intro: Junellia tridens, commonly known as the three-toothed junellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have three distinct tooth-like lobes, giving it its common name. Junellia tridens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
